place.name: MONXTON
place.gazetteerText: MONXTON, or MONKSTON, a parish, with a small village, in Andover district, Hants; 3¾ miles WSW of Andover r. station. Post town, Andover. Acres, 1,141. Real property, with Amport, Cholderton, and Sarson, £6,988. Rated property of M. alone, £1,294. Pop., 275. Houses, 58. The property belongs to King's College, Cambridge. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Winchester. Value, £338.,* Patron, King's College, Cambridge. The church has a tower, with slated spire, and is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
